meanings.definition: To tax excessively or too heavily.
meanings.sent1: The government should not overtreat its citizens by overtaking too much money from them in taxes.
meanings.sent2: It is not fair to overtreat the people by demanding too much tax from them.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a unicorn paying taxes would be as strange as a dragon trying to overtax a village.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the tax burden can sometimes feel like a giant hand trying to overtax your strength.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a greedy monster that wants to overtax every penny you earn, that's how excessive taxation feels.

meanings.sent1: Carrying too many books can overburden your backpack and overtreat your shoulders.
meanings.sent2: Don't overdo it at the gym and overtreat your muscles with too much weight.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle ten balls at once would overtreat even the most skilled circus performer.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world's problems can sometimes overtax even the strongest of us.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a tiny ant trying to overtax itself by carrying a huge crumb, that's how it feels to be overwhelmed.
